description:
Impose surface net heat flux anomalies over the ocean, calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling. Use a passive tracer to prevent negative climate feedback on the heat flux applied.
Impose pre-industrial atmospheric conditions. Branch from the piControl at the same point as the 1pctCO2 experiment.
keywords: FAFMIP, Tier 1, heatFAF, surface heat flux anomaly
long_name: control plus perturbative surface flux of heat into ocean
rationale: Heat flux changes are thought to be the main influence on Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) change and a major influence on the pattern of sea level change.

requirements.description: Impose heat flux anomalies to the ocean surface, created from the CMIP5 diagnostic of surface downward heat flux in sea-water (hfds).  The surface heat-flux anomalies are calculated from the ensemble mean of the CMIP5 1pctCO2 simulations at the time of CO2 doubling.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  Note that the fluxes themselves are not replaced because this would typically cause a very large climate drift and possible instability.  The method for implementing the heat flux anomaly should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, heat flux, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Heat Flux Anomaly At Doubling

requirements.description: Add a surface flux of passive tracer at the same rate as the surface heat flux perturbation in the faf-heat experiment.  The passive tracer flux will be added to the top layer of a passive temperature tracer.  Surface flux anomalies (a function of longitude, latitude and time of year) are to remain constant throughout the experiment.  The method for implementing the passive tracer should follow that used by Bouttes and Gregory (2014).
requirements.keywords: FAFMIP, 1pctCO2, heat flux, passive tracer, 2xCO2, at CO2 doubling
requirements.label: 1pctCO2 Passive Tracer At Doubling

requirements.description: Constant pre-industrial Carbon Dioxide (CO2) concentration. The CO2 concentration should be representative of Earth around the year 1850.
requirements.label: Pre-Industrial CO2 Concentration

requirements.keywords: Pre-industrial forcing, excluding carbon dioxide, excluding co2
requirements.label: Pre-Industrial Forcing Excluding CO2

requirements.description: Pre-Industrial solar particle forcing (1850-1873 mean). For models with interactive stratospheric chemistry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair production by galactic cosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
requirements.keywords: Solar forcing, Pre-Industrial, pi, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
requirements.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Particle Forcing

requirements.description: Initialisation from a January in the pre-industrial control simulation.
requirements.label: PreIndustrialInitialisation

requirements.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
requirements.label: AOGCM Configuration
